**长袍**（robe）是[NetHack](/index.php?title=NetHack/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "NetHack/zh-CN (page does not exist)")中的一种[斗篷](/wiki/%E6%96%97%E7%AF%B7 "斗篷")类[防具](/wiki/%E9%98%B2%E5%85%B7 "防具")。它是一种[魔法](/index.php?title=%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E7%89%A9%E5%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "魔法物品 (page does not exist)")斗篷，由[布](/index.php?title=%E5%B8%83\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "布 (page does not exist)")制成。

## 生成

[僧侣](/index.php?title=%E5%83%A7%E4%BE%A3\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "僧侣 (page does not exist)")在游戏开始时会获得一件+1长袍，[牧师](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师 (page does not exist)")在游戏开始时会获得一件+0长袍[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)。

[阵营祭司](/index.php?title=%E9%98%B5%E8%90%A5%E7%A5%AD%E5%8F%B8\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "阵营祭司 (page does not exist)")、[高阶祭司](/index.php?title=%E9%AB%98%E9%98%B6%E7%A5%AD%E5%8F%B8\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "高阶祭司 (page does not exist)")和[大祭司](/index.php?title=%E5%A4%A7%E7%A5%AD%E5%8F%B8\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "大祭司 (page does not exist)")在生成时有6⁄7的概率[获得](/index.php?title=%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%E8%B5%B7%E5%A7%8B%E7%89%A9%E5%93%81\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "怪物起始物品 (page does not exist)")一件长袍[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)。[宗师](/index.php?title=%E5%AE%97%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "宗师 (page does not exist)")和[凯恩大师](/index.php?title=%E5%87%AF%E6%81%A9%E5%A4%A7%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "凯恩大师 (page does not exist)")在生成时有10⁄11的概率获得一件长袍[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)。

非[僧侣](/index.php?title=%E5%83%A7%E4%BE%A3%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "僧侣（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")职业的[玩家怪物](/index.php?title=%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "玩家怪物 (page does not exist)")在生成时有约4.45%的概率获得一件长袍，僧侣职业的玩家怪物生成时一定会获得长袍[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)。[牧师](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")职业的玩家怪物的起始斗篷有3⁄4的概率被替换为长袍，因此其获得长袍的总概率是62.29%。[巫师](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88%EF%BC%88%E7%8E%A9%E5%AE%B6%E6%80%AA%E7%89%A9%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师（玩家怪物） (page does not exist)")职业的玩家怪物的起始斗篷有1⁄2的概率被替换为[魔法抵抗斗篷](/wiki/%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E6%8A%B5%E6%8A%97%E6%96%97%E7%AF%B7 "魔法抵抗斗篷")，因此其获得长袍的总概率只有约2.22%[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)。

*以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（[NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。*

根据[commit 20cbadc](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/20cbadcf85544cf9d0c3f4e4200b2800bab49c8e)，现在[牧师任务](/index.php?title=%E7%89%A7%E5%B8%88%E4%BB%BB%E5%8A%A1\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "牧师任务 (page does not exist)")的领袖大祭司生成时必定会获得一件+4长袍，[僧侣任务](/index.php?title=%E5%83%A7%E4%BE%A3%E4%BB%BB%E5%8A%A1\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "僧侣任务 (page does not exist)")的领袖宗师在生成时必定会获得一件+6长袍。

## 描述

长袍的基础[AC](/index.php?title=AC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "AC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")加成为2，且能提供[MC](/index.php?title=MC/zh-CN\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "MC/zh-CN (page does not exist)")2。穿戴长袍时，如果玩家穿戴金属[铠甲](/wiki/%E9%93%A0%E7%94%B2 "铠甲")，则铠甲对施法成功率的惩罚减半，若角色未穿戴金属铠甲，则根据金属铠甲对成功率的惩罚，赋予相应的成功率加成[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)。具体机制请参阅“[施法](/index.php?title=%E6%96%BD%E6%B3%95\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "施法 (page does not exist)")”条目。

## 策略

长袍是种罕见的防具，如果你想比较容易地获取它，你可以考虑培养一只强大的[宠物](/index.php?title=%E5%AE%A0%E7%89%A9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "宠物 (page does not exist)")，利用它击杀一名你不需要捐献的祭司来获取长袍（如果你不介意承受[谋杀](/index.php?title=%E8%B0%8B%E6%9D%80\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "谋杀 (page does not exist)")带来的惩罚，也可以亲自杀死祭司），若要挑战[无许愿](/index.php?title=%E6%97%A0%E8%AE%B8%E6%84%BF\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "无许愿 (page does not exist)")和[无变形](/index.php?title=%E6%97%A0%E5%8F%98%E5%BD%A2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "无变形 (page does not exist)")行为，这种手段是最方便的。运气好的话，也可以从僧侣或牧师角色留下的[骨档](/index.php?title=%E9%AA%A8%E6%A1%A3\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "骨档 (page does not exist)")里获取长袍。

如果需要使用一些功能性法术（例如[鉴定](/index.php?title=%E9%89%B4%E5%AE%9A%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E4%B9%A6\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "鉴定魔法书 (page does not exist)")、[解除诅咒](/index.php?title=%E8%A7%A3%E9%99%A4%E8%AF%85%E5%92%92%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E4%B9%A6\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "解除诅咒魔法书 (page does not exist)")和[吸血](/index.php?title=%E5%90%B8%E8%A1%80%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E4%B9%A6\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "吸血魔法书 (page does not exist)")），你可以留一件长袍备用。若能够和[卓越头盔](/wiki/%E5%8D%93%E8%B6%8A%E5%A4%B4%E7%9B%94 "卓越头盔")搭配，角色甚至能够使用一些技能等级[受限制](/index.php?title=%E5%8F%97%E9%99%90%E5%88%B6\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "受限制 (page does not exist)")的流派的法术（取决于角色职业）。

[巫师](/index.php?title=%E5%B7%AB%E5%B8%88\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "巫师 (page does not exist)")可能需要长袍来抵消[力量手套](/wiki/%E5%8A%9B%E9%87%8F%E6%89%8B%E5%A5%97 "力量手套")等金属防具的施法惩罚。穿戴长袍的巫师一般用[神魔克星](/index.php?title=%E7%A5%9E%E9%AD%94%E5%85%8B%E6%98%9F\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "神魔克星 (page does not exist)")或[艾奇奥匹亚之眼](/index.php?title=%E8%89%BE%E5%A5%87%E5%A5%A5%E5%8C%B9%E4%BA%9A%E4%B9%8B%E7%9C%BC\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "艾奇奥匹亚之眼 (page does not exist)")作为[魔法抵抗](/index.php?title=%E9%AD%94%E6%B3%95%E6%8A%B5%E6%8A%97\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "魔法抵抗 (page does not exist)")的来源。

对于以施法为主要战斗手段，且不需要斗篷来获取魔法抵抗的角色，长袍一般是最优选择。可参见[灰龙鳞甲VS银龙鳞甲](/index.php?title=%E7%81%B0%E9%BE%99%E9%B3%9E%E7%94%B2VS%E9%93%B6%E9%BE%99%E9%B3%9E%E7%94%B2\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "灰龙鳞甲VS银龙鳞甲 (page does not exist)")了解可用的构筑选项。

## 历史

长袍最初于[NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0")的衍生作品[NetHack Plus](/wiki/NetHack_Plus "NetHack Plus")出现，后于[NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0")首次加入原版游戏。在此版本之前，牧师会携带+0[锁子甲](/wiki/%E9%94%81%E5%AD%90%E7%94%B2 "锁子甲")开始游戏。

NetHack Plus及其后继衍生作品（特别是[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")）中长袍的机制和原版游戏区别较大：它是一件提供1 AC加成的[铠甲](/wiki/%E9%93%A0%E7%94%B2 "铠甲")，而非斗篷，不仅不阻碍施法，也是唯一一种不会给僧侣带来战斗能力惩罚的铠甲。

到[NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3")为止，长袍会提供[MC3](/index.php?title=%E9%94%80%E9%AD%94%EF%BC%883.4.3%EF%BC%89\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "销魔（3.4.3） (page does not exist)")。

## Variants

**此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。**  
您可以帮助我们[**翻译此页面**](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Robe/zh-CN\&action=edit)，但**请勿使用机器翻译**。

As explained above, the robe that appears in SLASH'EM and its variants is body armor that works very different from the robe of *NetHack*. With the exception of SLASH'EM, the sections below cover variants that use *NetHack*-style robes.

### SLASH'EM

- *Main article: [Robe (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Robe_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Robe (SLASH'EM)")*

In SLASH'EM, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), there are four types of body armor robe available:

- A standard robe.
- A [robe of power](/wiki/Robe_of_power "Robe of power"), which enhances spellcasting ability similar to the *NetHack* robe.
- A [robe of weakness](/wiki/Robe_of_weakness "Robe of weakness"), which sets base strength to 3.
- A [robe of protection](/wiki/Robe_of_protection "Robe of protection"), which offers 5 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC").

These robes can be found on monsters such as [wraiths](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)"), aligned priests and [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the second level of the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria") always generates a burnt robe atop the [wizard](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") on the narrow land bridge.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), a robe grants 0 base AC, 2 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") and MC3 while worn, and is normally always made of cloth.

[Incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier") characters will have the standard body armor of most roles replaced with a robe: the roles that *do not* replace body armor with a robe for Incantifiers are [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Nobles](/wiki/Noble "Noble"), [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") and [Troubadours](/wiki/Troubadour "Troubadour").

A robe is always generated in [minor spires](/wiki/Map_inclusion_\(dNethack\)#Minor_spire "Map inclusion (dNethack)") that appear within [the Outlands](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Outlands "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands") of the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Neutral Quest (dNetHack)").

Some monsters generate with a robe:

- The adventuring wizard of the [rebel leader](/wiki/Rebel_leader "Rebel leader") party that serves as the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest") nemesis always generates with a robe.
- [Center of All](/wiki/Center_of_All "Center of All") generates with a +0 large-sized concordant robe.
- [Xorn monks](/wiki/Xorn_monk "Xorn monk") have a 49⁄50 chance of generating with an orange-colored robe, which will have its enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation.
- [Uvuudaums](/wiki/Uvuudaum "Uvuudaum") always generate with a robe.

In addition to the standard robe, dNetHacks adds three types of very rare robes - the [white faceless robe](/index.php?title=White_faceless_robe\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White faceless robe (page does not exist)"), [black faceless robe](/index.php?title=Black_faceless_robe\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black faceless robe (page does not exist)") and the [smoky violet faceless robe](/index.php?title=Smoky_violet_faceless_robe\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Smoky violet faceless robe (page does not exist)"). dNetHack also adds a few [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") robes:

- [The Robe of Closed Eyes](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Robe_of_Closed_Eyes "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral robe that is made of leather, favors [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") Healers and acts as their first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"). It grants invisibility and gaze resistance while worn, and can be enchanted to +7.
- [The Grandmaster's Robe](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Grandmaster.27s_Robe "DNetHack artifacts") is a neutral robe that can also be [named](/wiki/Name "Name") by a character at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 30 that has reached Grand Master in martial arts - being gifted the Grandmaster's Robe unrestricts the martial arts skill if applicable. While worn, it grants double the spellcasting bonuses of a normal robe and gives martial arts attacks [exploding dice](/wiki/Exploding_dice "Exploding dice"), with a 1⁄2 chance of +1d4 bonus damage on each hit. The Grandmaster's Robe can be enchanted to +7.
- [The Robe of the Archmagi](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Robe_of_the_Archmagi "DNetHack artifacts") is an unaligned [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") robe that favors Wizards. It grants warning and magic resistance while worn, and can be enchanted to +7. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") the Robe of the Archmagi restores [energy](/wiki/Energy "Energy").

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, [Balaam](/index.php?title=Balaam\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Balaam (page does not exist)") is generated with a large-sized robe when summoned by an [Illithanachronounbinder](/wiki/Illithanachronounbinder "Illithanachronounbinder").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") and [tortles](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)") that play as Monks or Priests will have their starting robes replaced: giants are given [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots"), and tortles are given [toques](/wiki/Toque "Toque").

[The Dark One](/wiki/The_Dark_One "The Dark One") always generates with a robe, as does the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"). [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna") always generates with a cursed, rotted robe of [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"); this is one of the only instances in which a robe can generate with an [object property](/wiki/Object_property "Object property"), which is otherwise not possible for magical items and extremely rare for non-magical items that have an object property.

## 百科文本

Robes are the only garments, apart from Shirts, ever to have sleeves. They have three uses:  
1\. As the official uniform of Priests, Priestesses, Monks, Nuns (see Nunnery), and Wizards. The OMT \[ Official Management Term ] prescribed for the Robes of Priests and Nuns is that they \_fall in severe folds\_; of Priestesses that they \_float\_; and of Wizards that they \_swirl\_. You can thus see who you are dealing with.  
2\. For Kings. The OMT here is \_falling in stately folds\_.  
3\. As the garb of Desert Nomads. \[...]

\[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]

外观 长袍
装备槽位 斗篷

长袍（robe）是NetHack中的一种斗篷类防具。它是一种魔法斗篷，由布制成。

Contents

  • 1 生成
  • 2 描述
  • 3 策略
  • 4 历史
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 UnNetHack
    • 5.3 dNetHack
    • 5.4 notdNetHack
    • 5.5 EvilHack
  • 6 百科文本
  • 7 引用及注释

生成

僧侣在游戏开始时会获得一件+1长袍，牧师在游戏开始时会获得一件+0长袍[1][2]。

阵营祭司、高阶祭司和大祭司在生成时有6⁄7的概率获得一件长袍[3]。宗师和凯恩大师在生成时有10⁄11的概率获得一件长袍[4]。

非僧侣职业的玩家怪物在生成时有约4.45%的概率获得一件长袍，僧侣职业的玩家怪物生成时一定会获得长袍[5][6]。牧师职业的玩家怪物的起始斗篷有3⁄4的概率被替换为长袍，因此其获得长袍的总概率是62.29%。巫师职业的玩家怪物的起始斗篷有1⁄2的概率被替换为魔法抵抗斗篷，因此其获得长袍的总概率只有约2.22%[7][8]。

以下内容涉及即将到来的版本（NetHack 3.7.0）之信息。如果该版本已发布，请验证此处信息是否准确，并作出相应修改，以将其并入页面。

根据commit 20cbadc，现在牧师任务的领袖大祭司生成时必定会获得一件+4长袍，僧侣任务的领袖宗师在生成时必定会获得一件+6长袍。

描述

长袍的基础AC加成为2，且能提供MC2。穿戴长袍时，如果玩家穿戴金属铠甲，则铠甲对施法成功率的惩罚减半，若角色未穿戴金属铠甲，则根据金属铠甲对成功率的惩罚，赋予相应的成功率加成[9]。具体机制请参阅“施法”条目。

策略

长袍是种罕见的防具，如果你想比较容易地获取它，你可以考虑培养一只强大的宠物，利用它击杀一名你不需要捐献的祭司来获取长袍（如果你不介意承受谋杀带来的惩罚，也可以亲自杀死祭司），若要挑战无许愿和无变形行为，这种手段是最方便的。运气好的话，也可以从僧侣或牧师角色留下的骨档里获取长袍。

如果需要使用一些功能性法术（例如鉴定、解除诅咒和吸血），你可以留一件长袍备用。若能够和卓越头盔搭配，角色甚至能够使用一些技能等级受限制的流派的法术（取决于角色职业）。

巫师可能需要长袍来抵消力量手套等金属防具的施法惩罚。穿戴长袍的巫师一般用神魔克星或艾奇奥匹亚之眼作为魔法抵抗的来源。

对于以施法为主要战斗手段，且不需要斗篷来获取魔法抵抗的角色，长袍一般是最优选择。可参见灰龙鳞甲VS银龙鳞甲了解可用的构筑选项。

历史

长袍最初于NetHack 3.1.0的衍生作品NetHack Plus出现，后于NetHack 3.3.0首次加入原版游戏。在此版本之前，牧师会携带+0锁子甲开始游戏。

NetHack Plus及其后继衍生作品（特别是SLASH'EM）中长袍的机制和原版游戏区别较大：它是一件提供1 AC加成的铠甲，而非斗篷，不仅不阻碍施法，也是唯一一种不会给僧侣带来战斗能力惩罚的铠甲。

到NetHack 3.4.3为止，长袍会提供MC3。

Variants

此条目或段落的部分内容需要翻译。
您可以帮助我们翻译此页面，但请勿使用机器翻译。

As explained above, the robe that appears in SLASH'EM and its variants is body armor that works very different from the robe of NetHack. With the exception of SLASH'EM, the sections below cover variants that use NetHack-style robes.

SLASH'EM

Main article: Robe (SLASH'EM)

In SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, there are four types of body armor robe available:

  • A standard robe.
  • A robe of power, which enhances spellcasting ability similar to the NetHack robe.
  • A robe of weakness, which sets base strength to 3.
  • A robe of protection, which offers 5 base AC.

These robes can be found on monsters such as wraiths, aligned priests and mind flayers.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the second level of the Ruins of Moria always generates a burnt robe atop the wizard corpse on the narrow land bridge.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, a robe grants 0 base AC, 2 DR and MC3 while worn, and is normally always made of cloth.

Incantifier characters will have the standard body armor of most roles replaced with a robe: the roles that do not replace body armor with a robe for Incantifiers are Binders, Healers, Knights, Nobles, Tourists and Troubadours.

A robe is always generated in minor spires that appear within the Outlands of the Neutral Quest.

Some monsters generate with a robe:

  • The adventuring wizard of the rebel leader party that serves as the default Noble quest nemesis always generates with a robe.
  • Center of All generates with a +0 large-sized concordant robe.
  • Xorn monks have a 49⁄50 chance of generating with an orange-colored robe, which will have its enchantment increased by 1-4 points after creation.
  • Uvuudaums always generate with a robe.

In addition to the standard robe, dNetHacks adds three types of very rare robes - the white faceless robe, black faceless robe and the smoky violet faceless robe. dNetHack also adds a few artifact robes:

  • The Robe of Closed Eyes is a neutral robe that is made of leather, favors drow Healers and acts as their first sacrifice gift. It grants invisibility and gaze resistance while worn, and can be enchanted to +7.
  • The Grandmaster's Robe is a neutral robe that can also be named by a character at experience level 30 that has reached Grand Master in martial arts - being gifted the Grandmaster's Robe unrestricts the martial arts skill if applicable. While worn, it grants double the spellcasting bonuses of a normal robe and gives martial arts attacks exploding dice, with a 1⁄2 chance of +1d4 bonus damage on each hit. The Grandmaster's Robe can be enchanted to +7.
  • The Robe of the Archmagi is an unaligned intelligent robe that favors Wizards. It grants warning and magic resistance while worn, and can be enchanted to +7. Invoking the Robe of the Archmagi restores energy.

notdNetHack

In notdNetHack, in addition to dNetHack details, Balaam is generated with a large-sized robe when summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, giants and tortles that play as Monks or Priests will have their starting robes replaced: giants are given high boots, and tortles are given toques.

The Dark One always generates with a robe, as does the Wizard of Yendor. Vecna always generates with a cursed, rotted robe of drain resistance; this is one of the only instances in which a robe can generate with an object property, which is otherwise not possible for magical items and extremely rare for non-magical items that have an object property.

百科文本

Robes are the only garments, apart from Shirts, ever to have sleeves. They have three uses:
1. As the official uniform of Priests, Priestesses, Monks, Nuns (see Nunnery), and Wizards. The OMT [ Official Management Term ] prescribed for the Robes of Priests and Nuns is that they _fall in severe folds_; of Priestesses that they _float_; and of Wizards that they _swirl_. You can thus see who you are dealing with.
2. For Kings. The OMT here is _falling in stately folds_.
3. As the garb of Desert Nomads. [...]

[ The Tough Guide to Fantasyland, by Diana Wynne Jones ]
